title: Heroes Stadium
text:
Heroes Stadium is an 11,000-seat, open style <a href="American%20Football">football</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> serving the public school district <a href="North%20East%20Independent%20School%20District">North East ISD</a> in <a href="San%20Antonio">San Antonio</a>, <a href="Texas">Texas</a>, USA. It opened in 2009, built on the site of the abandoned Longhorn Quarry, and has 2,525 paved parking spaces. $27.5 million of funding was provided by a 2007 school district bond. A video board system measuring was installed in 2010. Along with <a href="Comalander%20Stadium">Comalander Stadium</a>, Heroes is the home venue for the football, track and field, soccer, and band events for the high schools in the <a href="North%20East%20Independent%20School%20District">North East Independent School District</a>, and also plays host to various athletic events for the district's middle and elementary schools.
The stadium received national exposure on August 27, 2010, when it held a game between local <a href="James%20Madison%20High%20School%20%28San%20Antonio%2C%20Texas%29">Madison Mavericks</a> and <a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20120217140858/http%3A//www.scuc.txed.net/ByronSteele.cfm">Steele Knights</a> of <a href="Cibolo%2C%20Texas">Cibolo</a>. The game was televised by <a href="ESPN">ESPN</a>, as part of its High School Rise Kickoff Event.
The venue hosted the <a href="San%20Antonio%20Scorpions%20FC">San Antonio Scorpions</a> in their inaugural <a href="2012%20San%20Antonio%20Scorpions%20FC%20season">2012</a> <a href="North%20American%20Soccer%20League%20%282011%29">NASL</a> <a href="2012%20North%20American%20Soccer%20League%20season">season</a>. The team played at the site to an average attendance of 9,176, including a couple of sellout crowds, while their stadium, <a href="Toyota%20Field">Toyota Field</a>, was being completed.
